multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates; rising US rates, inflation, and tariff costs push Fed policy tightening, lifting US Treasury yields and pressuring retail sector.

article_node.title: At Home closing 29 'underperforming' stores, including one in Florida. What to know
article_node.summary: At Home, a home‑goods retailer, is closing 29 underperforming stores by September 30 as part of its Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing. The closures, including a Miami location, are driven by higher interest rates, persistent inflation and rising tariff‑related customs costs. The move follows a broader trend of big‑box retailers shuttering stores amid retail‑specific pressures.
